meanings.definition: To treat someone as a celebrity or idol.
meanings.sent1: People often lionise famous actors and singers.
meanings.sent2: Fans tend to lionise their favorite athletes.
meanings.sent3: At the event, everyone seemed to lionise the guest speaker.
meanings.sent4: In the world of entertainment, it is common to lionise successful individuals.
meanings.sent5: The media loves to lionise popular personalities.

meanings.definition: To show admiration or respect for someone.
meanings.sent1: She would always lionise her mentor for his guidance.
meanings.sent2: Students often lionise their teachers for their knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The children would lionise their grandparents for their wisdom.
meanings.sent4: In the community, people lionise those who volunteer their time to help others.
meanings.sent5: It is important to lionise individuals who make a positive impact on society.
